title: 109_hr1299
content: The Act titled "Critical Habitat Enhancement Act of 2005" designates critical habitat and sets a standard for its designation. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to designate critical habitat for endangered species, with specific regulations outlined for the Secretary to follow. The Secretary must designate critical habitat for a species within one year of finalizing a recovery plan or three years after determining the species as endangered or threatened. The designation can be revised periodically, and any area designated as critical habitat does not apply to actions authorized by specific exemptions. The curr_chunk discusses the authorization of actions in designated critical habitat areas under specific permits, written statements, or conservation programs. It clarifies that this authorization does not establish regulatory requirements or have any binding effect. Repeal of Section 4(b)(6)(C) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973. SEC. 3. BASIS FOR DETERMINATION. Section 4(b)(2) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include provisions for determining critical habitat, including seeking information from State and local governments and considering economic impacts. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include provisions for determining critical habitat, considering economic impacts, and requiring the Secretary to first consider all areas known to be occupied by the species when designating critical habitat. Landowners may be affected when seeking permits or approvals under Federal, State, or local law. SEC. 4. CONTENT OF NOTICES OF PROPOSED DESIGNATION OF CRITICAL HABITAT. Section 4(b)(5)(A) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to include specific requirements for publishing maps and coordinates for critical habitat designations. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 now requires the publication of critical habitat maps, coordinates, and field survey data on a publicly accessible Department webpage. Each notice must reference this webpage. SEC. 5. CLARIFICATION OF DEFINITION OF CRITICAL HABITAT. Section 3(5) of the Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to specify the areas that are considered critical habitat for endangered species, including physical and biological features necessary for their survival. The Endangered Species Act of 1973 is amended to define critical habitat as areas essential for species survival, including specific geographical areas occupied by the species for breeding, feeding, sheltering, or other essential behaviors.
